#Text=Build A Magnetic Catch Bottle Opener
#Text=Not much is more satisfying that making something with your own hands .
#Text=A magnetic catch bottle opener makes a great gift for friends , for family , groomsmen , house-warming or just about anyone who has ever needed to use a bottle opener .
#Text=Whether you 're a first time builder , hobbyist or woodworker , this will walk you through the steps on how to make your very own !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Gather your supplies and clean your work area .
#Text=Charge batteries on any cordless tools .
#Text=Consider how you want to lay out a design .
#Text=This project will be using a simpler method and you can keep this as easy or as complex as you want .
#Text=Determine the length and the width that you would like your finished project to be .
#Text=At the very simplest ( using only one piece of wood ) those will be your final dimensions .
#Text=In this guide , you ’ll be using two different species of wood .
#Text=Using a main piece , made of red oak , and a secondary piece made of walnut .
#Text=This finished project will be 4 inches wide and 9.5 inches tall .
#Text=Cut the wood to the appropriate length and width using a miter saw , and a table saw or circular saw ( for all cuts ) .
#Text=Cut the wood to 10 inches in length .
#Text=You will trim down excess later .
#Text=For the width cut , you can go as narrow or as wide as you would like depending on how you want your finished product to look .
#Text=In this project , we will cut two pieces of the red oak to 1 inch in width , one piece of the red oak to 1.5 inches in width , and the walnut we will cut two pieces to 0.25 inches in width .
#Text=You should now have : ( x2 ) Walnut – 10 ” x 0.25 ”
#Text=( x2 )
#Text=Red Oak - 10 ” x 1 ” ( x1 )
#Text=Red Oak – 10 " x 1.5 ”
